nodes.text: The Queen's library was a library in the Theed Royal Palace down the hallway from the royal apartments on the fifth floor, reserved for the use of the Queen of Naboo. Early in her reign, Padmé Amidala and her handmaidens used a short trip to and from the library as a test to see if the guards could be fooled by the queen switching places with one of the handmaidens as a decoy. Later, Amidala and Rabé exited via the library window, using a grappling hook, when the queen and most of her handmaidens went to a Neurotransmitter Affection concert at the Theed Odeon incognito.
